decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board through a combination of removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing "Blade Control" elements with Stoneforge Mystic and various swords. Squadron Hawk helps maintain card advantage, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura provide additional control options and win conditions. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirements of the deck, with both fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana access. The ultimate goal is to outlast the opponent and dominate the game through superior card advantage and board control.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board by using powerful creatures like Precursor Golem, Avenger of Zendikar, and Inferno Titan, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Mana Leak. The deck also aims to ramp up its mana quickly with Lotus Cobra and Explore, allowing it to play big threats early on. Cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oracle of Mul Daya provide card advantage and additional control options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent through a combination of control and ramp.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also deploying threats like Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers additional control and card advantage. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Sun Titan and Celestial Colonnade, while also having access to powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine to close out the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, board wipes, and utilizing powerful planeswalkers. It utilizes Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic to draw cards and search for key equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Mana Leak, Spell Pierce, Cancel, and Deprive. The deck also includes support cards like Sylvok Lifestaff for lifegain. With a mix of card draw, board control, and powerful creatures and planeswalkers, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The focus of this deck centers around utilizing control elements such as counter spells and removal alongside creatures and artifacts with strong utility abilities to manipulate the board state. The main win conditions come from ramping up mana with artifacts and using Grand Architect to quickly cast powerful spells like Wurmcoil Engine and Steel Hellkite. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and disruption while Inkmoth Nexus offers an alternate win condition through infect. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through a combination of controlling the game and generating strong threats.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, board wipes, and using powerful planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes equipment like Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful swords to equip to your creatures and maintain board presence. Squadron Hawk helps with card advantage and fetching more threats, while Celestial Colonnade provides a strong finisher. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

The main idea of this deck is to use aggressive red creatures and powerful burn spells to quickly defeat the opponent. With efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Plated Geopede, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, the deck can apply pressure early on. Equipment like Basilisk Collar and Sword of Body and Mind provide additional utility and combat tricks. The deck's mana base allows for quick access to red mana sources, while cards like Koth of the Hammer provide additional late-game power. Overall, the deck aims to win through speed and direct damage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by generating value through powerful creatures like Precursor Golem, Frost Titan, and Inferno Titan. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Mana Leak and Lightning Bolt to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. Additionally, cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore help ramp up mana production, allowing for the quick deployment of threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Garruk Wildspeaker provides additional utility and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

This Boros Landfall deck focuses on quickly playing and pumping up creatures with landfall abilities to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Steppe Lynx, along with equipment like Adventuring Gear and Sword of Body and Mind to further boost their power. Lightning Bolt and other removal spells help control the board while Stoneforge Mystic and Journey to Nowhere provide additional utility. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent land drops to trigger landfall abilities effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly playing landfall creatures to take advantage of their abilities, while also utilizing aggressive creatures and equipment to deal damage efficiently. By consistently playing lands and triggering landfall abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced and explosive offensive strategy. The synergy between landfall triggers, aggressive creature cards, and equipment allows for a versatile and unpredictable gameplay that can catch opponents off guard and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a mix of counterspells and removal, while also utilizing equipment to enhance its creatures. The key strategy involves playing efficient threats like Mirran Crusader and Squadron Hawk, while also being able to tutor for powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine using Stoneforge Mystic. By utilizing cards like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's plays, the deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and secure victory through well-timed equipment attachments and card advantage provided by Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through counterspells and board wipes while also utilizing equipment to improve the efficiency of creatures. The deck aims to establish board presence through Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic, while also disrupting opponents' strategies with counterspells like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce. Sword of Feast and Famine provides additional value by untapping lands and forcing opponents to discard. Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offer additional control options and win conditions. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue opponents through careful resource management and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and board wipes while utilizing equipment to enhance its creatures. The main strategy is to establish board presence through Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic, while disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce. Day of Judgment serves as a reset button, clearing the board when necessary. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional control options. The equipment cards provide additional value and versatility to the creatures, allowing for multiple lines of play.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of efficient counterspells, board wipes, and removal to control the game while establishing a powerful late-game win condition with equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sword of Vengeance. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic, while maintaining a strong board presence with planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By effectively managing resources and disrupting opponents' strategies, the deck can dominate the battlefield and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells and board wipes to maintain board control while also utilizing equipment to buff creatures for added pressure. The key strategy involves efficiently fetching and equipping powerful swords like Sword of Body and Mind and Sword of Feast and Famine using Stoneforge Mystic, while also generating card advantage through Squadron Hawk and card filtering with Preordain. The deck aims to control the game's pace and out-value opponents with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth Tirel.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the pieces needed to complete the "Holy Quest" of finding and equipping powerful artifacts like Argentum Armor and Sword of Body and Mind. Using cheap creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, alongside cards like Fauna Shaman and Squadron Hawk to search for key pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive early plays and powerful equipment. The goal is to quickly establish a board presence and equip powerful artifacts to close out the game.
